content.description: Excellent the whole way.  A hard and powerful feet cutting boulder out the roof leads to technical power face climbing through beautiful rock and smeary feet.  Stay calm at the marginal rest beneath the upper roof and dont pump out through steep jugs and a couple final moves to the chains.  Splendid climbing.
content.location: Proud line at the left side of Rebel Wall near the scramble up to Little Rebel WAll

content.description: Begin beneath a little roof/dihedral.  Climb into the dihedral and break out left onto the arete.  Follow good holds through the arete onto the upper face to the chains
content.location: Right around the corner from the top of the approach trail

content.description:
Shares the first two bolts with CC Rider. After the second bolt trend left to a bulgy dihedral crux. Continue making your way up the corner to the anchors after standing on the ledge.

 Beware of potential loose blocks halfway up
content.location: Left of CC Rider, shares first two bolts

climbs.name: Tom's Sweet Double Dyno Hueco Route

content.description: Start up a little choss up to the business.  Climb excellent steep climbing up to Dyno #1.  Reload and Dyno again.  Trend right and hang on until the chains.
content.location: First route you come up to after the dirty approach scramble from the main trail

content.description: Begin from the ground in a little stemming corner beneath the ledge and climb up the the first stance past the second bolt.  Pull through three or four crimper moves to a ledge and traverse left. Begin very fun and sequency face climbing. Be Warned- Full 60 Meter Rope Stretcher.
content.location: First route before the 12 foot ledge starts, center left of the rebel wall.

content.description: Like it's counterparts in this area, this route is steep, juggy, and fun.  Pull a few crimpy moves off the ground until you get into better holds after the first bolt.  Keep swinging your way up until you reach the ledge.  Have a shake then pull the roof through decent holds until your up on your feet.  The Anchors are located a bit out of the way off to the left of where you pull the roof, it's an easy traverse to get to them.
content.location: Left-Center of the steep section on Rebel Wall

content.description: Begin to the right of Stars and Bars off of the same edge.  Move through sustained climbing to a good stance beneath a right leaning ramp.  Work up the ramp and gain a ledge.  Move through easier face climbing to the chains.
content.location: Center left of the Rebel Wall

content.description: Classic steep power-endurance climbing. Stick clip the high first bolt. Low crux sequence through first three bolts.  Trend right through bigger holds on steeper terrain to a couple jugs and a final dead point to the finish.
content.location: Right of Chunky Monkey in the steep shorter section of Rebel wall.

content.description: Begin on 5.9 choss as you make your way up to the dihedral crack.  This rock is loose and needs cleaning, but there are a few places for gear about 15 feet up.  Once you reach the crack this route takes good gear the rest of the way.  Pull a hard bulge move into the dihedral and work your way up to the roof crux.  A few hard pulls to a hero move out the roof provide excellent exposure and fun.
content.protection: Standard rack of cams with 2- #3 pieces.  1 bolt + Anchors
content.location: Obvious Dihedral crack at the top of approach trail to rebel wall.

content.description: Begin up chossy rock until ledge where you can clip the first bolt.  Pull the roof and move left through wavy jugs into the crux on the upper face.
content.location: Right above the approach trail to Rebel wall.  Route left of CC Rider

content.description: Begin on a beautiful seam of porcelain sandstone creating techy face climbing that leads to a slopey horizontal before a powerful roof pull.  Finish up grand finger buckets to a mantle into the chains.
content.location: Obvious seam semi-central on "Little Rebels" Wall.

content.description: A short and fun route.  Right trending jugs on continually steep terrain climb through really fun holds to the chains
content.location: This is at the "Little Rebels" wall.  After the main approach to rebel wall, go directly left at the base of the cliff and scrable a 10' section of 4th class rock to get to little rebels wall.  This route is the left most route of this section beginning with easy climbing to the first bolt where there is a left trending flake that transitions into steep climbing.

content.description: Another Short Fun 5.11 at the Rebel Wall.  Begin with a challenging two bolt boulder problem to start with followed by an excellent rest.  Move through pumpy climbing with better holds.  Pull the roof for the finish.
content.location: First route beginning the short steep section climbers right of Rebel Yell

content.description: Obvious dihedral Crack leading to semi-run out face climbing to chains
content.location: Obvious Dihedral crack at very beginning of "little Rebel Wall"

content.description: Another steep, short, fun romp.  Crank a few hard opening moves into big holds until the ledge stance.  Pull through the roof on decent holds to the anchors.
content.location: Center of the short steep section of rebel wall.

content.description: Super fun and varied climbing.  CC Rider starts on an easy slab to a ledge where you can clip the first bolt.  Climb through big and unique holds to a large undercling.  Here the route gets progressively steeper with small holds here and there to help build the pump to the mantle finish.
Climbs easier terrain to the first bolt on the slab below the roof. Good holds to a standing rest before the crux boulder problem. Fun movement through the final face to anchors on top of the ledge.
This area has a good mix of intermediate routes, some vertical and longer and others steep and short.  Decent winter sun and tree shade in spring and fall.  Mainly sport routes.
